blogs.headline: New Finds
blogs.prev: Anything new I find, I‚Äôll put here

post.value: I got the original Star Wars soundtrack on vinyl a few years ago, but for Christmas I received The Empire Strikes Back and Return of the Jedi, completing the original trilogy.

Something I like about records are the artist notes that come with it. In the original Star Wars record, there‚Äôs a sheet where John Williams explains some of what went into the different themes and songs. For example, the recognizable ‚ÄúCantina Band‚Äù is the only song on the soundtrack that didn‚Äôt utilize the London Symphony Orchestra. George Lucas suggested Williams imagine ‚Äúseveral creatures in a future century finding some 1930s Benny Goodman swing band music in a time capsule or under a rock someplace ‚Äî and how they might attempt to interpret it‚Äù.

I think the Empire Strikes Back has some of my favorite pieces. From the well-known ‚ÄúThe Imperial March (Darth Vader‚Äôs Theme)‚Äù to the love theme between Han and Leia and the dramatic piece that underlines the duel between Luke and Vader.

I always really liked ‚ÄúThe Return of the Jedi‚Äù as a kid. The song plays during the dramatic rescue of Han Solo from Jabba the Hutt as Luke acrobats his way across the desert skiffs to the main barge.

post.value: This box set consists of the six original albums by The Cars. I feel like if I could go back and see any band live, it would be The Cars (or maybe Queen, but The Cars is definitely up there).
If you look closely, this one‚Äôs signed!
Also with a beautiful pearl-colored vinyl
Coldplay - A Rush of Blood to the Head
I did like a lot of these songs when I was little, but it might be the fact that this was also the record on the player when I had my first kiss that puts it on the favorites list üò≥.
Def Leppard - The Story So Far
This ‚Äúbest of‚Äù album came out a few months after I went to a Def Leppard/Journey concert with my mom in 2018. Plus, it includes a cover of Depeche Mode‚Äôs Personal Jesus on its own 7‚Äù single.
There‚Äôs just something so fun about this song!

An album I ‚Äústole‚Äù from my grandparents. It‚Äôs a collection of hit songs from the late 1950s. Notable songs include The Platters‚Äô ‚ÄúSmoke Gets In Your Eyes‚Äù and Dinah Washington‚Äôs ‚ÄúWhat A Diff'rence A Day Makes‚Äù.
John F. Kennedy - John F. Kennedy: The Presidential Years
Another album I ‚Äústole‚Äù from my grandparents. I‚Äôve only listened to it once, but it‚Äôs one of those records you have just to say you do.
